thread.title: Philly's David Boreanaz's post-'Bones' role: Navy SEAL on CBS
thread.title_full: Philly's David Boreanaz's post-'Bones' role: Navy SEAL on CBS

author: Ellen Gray
title: Philly's David Boreanaz's post-'Bones' role: Navy SEAL on CBS

organizations.name: share ellen gray television critic  ellen gray

text:
Philly's David Boreanaz's post-'Bones' role: Navy SEAL on CBS Updated: March 22, 2017 — 5:18 PM EDT 3 Share Ellen Gray Television Critic 
Ellen Gray is the television critic for the Daily News and the Inquirer, and has written about TV since 1994. Her mind will go blank if you ask her to name her favorite show, because she has so many, but she would love to hear about yours. 
Find her columns here . Mar 20 
That didn't take long. 
Philadelphia's David Boreanaz, whose 12-season run starring opposite Emily Deschanel in Fox's Bones ends on Tuesday in a finale he directed, already has his next role in sight, reports Deadline . 
The Malvern Prep grad, the son of retired 6ABC weather forecaster Dave Roberts , is replacing Jim Caviezel ( Person of Interest ) as the lead in a CBS pilot about Navy SEALs in which he'll play "the respected, committed leader of his assault team who’s been through over a dozen deployments, with scars inside and out," according to Deadline. Boreanaz will also be a producer on the project. 
Before Bones, Boreanaz starred for five seasons as the title character in Angel , a spinoff of Buffy the Vampire Slayer , which first introduced him as a vampire with a conscience. 
Caviezel reportedly left the SEALs project over creative differences.
